items.title: Elevate your outdoor space with Govee’s 33 or 72-foot Matter Deck Lights back at Prime Day lows from $59 (Reg. $100+)
items.summary:
By way of its official Amazon storefront, Govee is bringing back Prime Day low pricing on its Outdoor Deck Lights with Matter, with the 33-foot 6-pack down at $58.99 shipped, while the 72-foot 12-pack is down at $104.49 shipped, and sadly the 112-foot 18-pack is remaining at its full price. These multi-packs usually go for $100 and $170 at full price, which we’ve been seeing hold down at $65 and $110 since August. These rates first popped up during last week’s Prime Day event, with today’s deals giving you a second chance. You’ll be getting 41% and 39% markdowns while things last, cutting $41 and $66 off the going rates for the lowest prices we have tracked.

more…

items.summary:
Travelambo Minimalist Leather Wallet

Buy for $5 (Reg. $7)

Apply code H4H4W3KH during checkout.

What we love

While there are certainly times when I opt for a MagSafe wallet, I more commonly gravitate towards a minimalist offering like this. Before adding cards, you’re looking at a thickness of just 0.12 inches. It’s up to you how bulky you want to make it from there, with 6 card slots ready and waiting.

items.title: Russian air attacks hit Ukraine's gas sector, force Kyiv to import more gas
items.summary: KYIV (Reuters) -Russian attacks have forced Ukraine to suspend activities at several major gas facilities this month, the state energy company said on Thursday, leaving Kyiv in need of more imports. Read full story

items.title: Sources: OpenAI is proposing a "sign in with ChatGPT" feature for websites, letting startups charge OpenAI model usage costs to users' ChatGPT capacity limits (Stephanie Palazzolo/The Information)
items.summary:
Stephanie Palazzolo / The Information:
Sources: OpenAI is proposing a “sign in with ChatGPT” feature for websites, letting startups charge OpenAI model usage costs to users' ChatGPT capacity limits  —  OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on a podcast last week that he wanted ChatGPT to become “people's personal AI subscription.”

items.title: A new wave of social media apps provide hope in a doomscrolling world
items.summary: “The platforms that won were the ones that kept people scrolling the longest, not the ones that made them feel the most connected,”  Zehra Naqvi told TechCrunch. “Now there is an abundance of content but a scarcity of joy.”

items.title: Travel all terrains on Segway’s ZT3 Pro e-scooter with Apple Find My and proximity locking at its $850 low (Reg. $1,000+)
items.summary:
Looking in on Segway’s extended Fall Prime Day Sale, you have through the rest of the week to hop on the ZT3 Pro Electric All-Terrain Scooter at $849.99 shipped, which also matches the price at Amazon. While it may carry a $1,300 MSRP direct from Segway, you can normally find it down at $1,000 at Amazon. We saw it previously drop to this rate for the first and only time during July’s Prime Day event, with this being the second chance at its best pricing. You’ll be scoring $150 off the going rate (and $450 off the MSRP) for the all-time lowest price we have tracked. Be sure to check out the full lineup of Segway EV Prime Day deals in our original coverage here.

This particular model hit the scene towards the end of last year carrying a $550 price tag, and it’s now seeing a 45% discount. Today’s deal shaves $252 off its usual going rate, knocking it down to the lowest price we can find. Amazon currently has the same monitor listed for $399, making Newegg’s offer worth considering if you’re in the market to buy a speedy display for your battlestation. Head below for more details.

items.title: How a headphone site operator built loyalty startup Lantern to solve his own problems
items.summary: After struggling to retain customers at his e-commerce site Headphones.com, founder Andrew Lissimore built his own loyalty solution — and it’s now a startup called Lantern. The Shopify-native platform helps brands boost retention through customizable loyalty, referrals, and account management tools.

items.title: Save up to an exclusive $970 on refurbished Anker SOLIX units like the F3800 power station at a second-best $1,709

One of the notable standouts that is also seeing the largest price cut is the Anker SOLIX F3800 Portable Power Station at $1,709.05 shipped, after using the exclusive code 9TO5RBANKER at checkout for an additional 5% off. This renewed model is dropping from $2,679 to $1,799 with the starting discount, and the exclusive code cuts an extra $90 from the tag – which beats out the best pricing we’ve seen on a new unit by $490. We’ve had two previous exclusive deals on this refurbished station over the year, with today’s deal only beaten out by a drop to $1,699 from May. You’re getting the second-best price here with a $970 markdown, landing it just $10 shy of the May low. Head below for more on this and the other units benefitting from these discounts.

items.title: Ripple acquires GTreasury, a platform used by Fortune 500 companies for managing cash, foreign exchange, and risk, for $1B, set to close in the coming months (Krisztian Sandor/CoinDesk)
items.summary:
Krisztian Sandor / CoinDesk:
Ripple acquires GTreasury, a platform used by Fortune 500 companies for managing cash, foreign exchange, and risk, for $1B, set to close in the coming months  —  The deal, pending regulatory approvals, would give Ripple access to large enterprise clients as it is building out financial services around its digital asset business.

items.title: Pinterest adds controls to let you  limit the amount of ‘AI slop’ in your feed
items.summary: Pinterest is rolling out new controls that let users limit how much AI-generated content appears in their feeds. The company is also making its AI content labels more visible.

items.title: General Intuition lands $134M seed to teach agents spatial reasoning using video game clips
items.summary: Late last year, OpenAI reportedly tried to buy Medal and its vast trove of video game data for $500M. Today, the company spun out a frontier research lab that's using that data to build AI agents that understand how they move through space and time, a concept called spatial-temporal reasoning.

items.title: Amazon launches pay-per-visit virtual healthcare service for kids
items.summary: Amazon’s One Medical is expanding into pediatric care with a new pay-per-visit virtual health service for children ages 2 to 11. Starting at $29 for message-based visits and $49 for video calls, the service treats common conditions like pink eye, eczema, and rashes, and also handles medication renewals

items.summary:
Update: Microsoft’s new Xbox ROG Ally and ROG Ally X PC gaming handhelds are now available to purchase. Best Buy currently has them in stock and shipping with prices starting at $599.99 shipped for the standard Xbox ROG Ally. More details in the original post below.

A little over a month after Xbox confirmed the release date of its upcoming gaming handhelds, the ROG Ally and ROG Ally X are now available for pre-order. That also puts an end to all the speculation around pricing. The ROG Ally is priced at $599.99 shipped, while the more powerful ROG Ally X comes in at $999.99 shipped. The standard ROG Ally, which comes in white, can be pre-ordered from Amazon, Best Buy, and Walmart. items.title: Apple Watch Ultra 3 deals are live, but you can land Ultra 2 at $150 off right now too
items.summary:
There are some early deals on Apple Watch Ultra 3 over at Amazon right now, as well as the open-box discounts via Best Buy we detailed previously, but we are also tracking solid $150 price drops on Apple Watch Ultra 2. There are some notable enhancements on the new model, but at a glance the Ultra 2 is basically identical and I’m still still on the fence whether an upgrade is warranted for me personally. If you’re in the same boat or just looking to land an Ultra 2 for the first time, Amazon and Best Buy have them at $150 off right now. 

more…

items.title: Insta360’s latest X5 360-degree action camera is down to its lowest price at $500
items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you’ll find Insta360’s official storefront offering its latest X5 360-degree action camera for $499.99 shipped. This is regularly a $550 unit, which is now seeing a $50 discount. While not a huge deal, it’s still a notable one as it marks the lowest price we have tracked for this model to date since its debut earlier this year. Alternatively, you can pick between a bunch of other bundles – including the Essentials, Starter, and Motorcycle – that are now discounted at Amazon as well with up to $61 off. Head below for more details.
